title: Phase 3: Tool Deep-Dives Priority Order
content:
## Phase 3 Tool Deep-Dives — Approved Priority Order

### Priority 1: fast_search (Bucket B+D, 1-2 sessions)
- Unlock unused Tantivy: fuzzy matching, phrase search, doc comment search, signature search
- Most-used discovery tool, core differentiator
- Code-aware tokenization already strong (just fixed false positives)

### Priority 2: fast_refs (Bucket A+D, 1-2 sessions)
- **CRITICAL: Unlock 1.2M identifiers per workspace** (currently 0% utilization)
- Transform from relationship-based refs to LSP-quality find-all-usages
- Differentiate from Claude Code's native lsp_find_references

### Priority 3: get_symbols (Bucket B, 1 session)
- Most-used tool by token volume, already strong
- Audit for output optimization and semantic remnant cleanup

### Priority 4: trace_call_path (Bucket B+D, 1 session)
- Unique cross-language capability
- Add relationship kind filtering (calls vs type_usage vs imports)

### Priority 5: fast_explore (Bucket B+D, 1-2 sessions)
- Types table only 10% utilized, business logic metadata untapped
- 5 modes may be overloaded

### Priority 6: fast_goto (Bucket A, 1 session)
- Probably already solid (3-stage CASCADE)
- Quick audit, semantic remnant cleanup

### Priority 7: Editing tools (Bucket C, 1 session)
- edit_lines, fuzzy_replace, edit_symbol — investigate underuse
- Keep/kill/consolidate decision

### Priority 8: Memory tools (Bucket B, 1 session)
- checkpoint/recall/plan — recently overhauled, quick audit

### Priority 9: manage_workspace (Infrastructure, 0.5 session)
- Health check accuracy, completeness

### Kill: find_logic (Bucket C)
- Already deprecated, redirect to fast_explore(mode='logic')

## 6-Point Checklist Per Tool
1. Data utilization — what SQLite/Tantivy data is it ignoring?
2. Output optimization — token-efficient? Agent-friendly?
3. Semantic remnants — dead params, stale descriptions, embedding refs
4. Code quality — Rust anti-patterns, unnecessary clones, stringly-typed logic
5. Test coverage — fill gaps, validate findings
6. Dogfood test — run against Julie's own codebase

## Data Utilization Targets
- Identifiers: 0% → unlock in fast_refs (Priority 2)
- Types: 10% → improve in fast_explore (Priority 5)
- Relationships: 30% → improve in trace_call_path (Priority 4)
- Symbol metadata: 0% → expose where useful
- Tantivy capabilities: ~30% → unlock in fast_search (Priority 1)
